section.para: The commit command allows you to generate smart, AI-powered commit messages for your Git changes. This document explains all available options and combinations.

section.title: Basic Usage
section.para:
By default, this command:
Analyzes your staged Git changes
Generates a concise commit title only
Uses local LLM if configured, or falls back to Penify API

section.title: <tt>-m, --message</tt>
section.para: Provide context for the commit message generation:
This hint helps the AI understand your intention and improves the quality of the generated message.

section.title: <tt>-e, --terminal</tt>
section.para: Open an editor to review and edit the generated commit message before committing:
This opens your default Git editor with the generated message for review.

section.title: <tt>-d, --description</tt>
section.para: Generate a detailed commit message with both title and description:
Without this flag, only the commit title is generated.

section.title: Option Combinations
section.para: You can combine these options for different workflows:

section.title: Generate Title and Description with Context
Generate and Edit Full Commit Message
Using Local LLM
section.para: If you've configured a local LLM using penify config llm, the commit command will automatically use it for message generation.

Benefits:
Privacy: your code changes don't leave your machine
Speed: no network latency
Works offline

section.title: JIRA Enhancement
section.para: If you've configured JIRA integration using penify config jira, the commit command will:

listitem.para: Detect JIRA issue references in your changes
Fetch issue details from your JIRA instance
Include issue information in the commit message
Format the commit message according to JIRA's smart commit format

section.para:
Example output: PROJ-123: Fix authentication bug in login flow
- Updated OAuth token validation - Fixed session timeout handling - Added unit tests for edge cases
[PROJ-123]

section.title: Configuration Requirements
section.para: For the commit command to work:

listitem.para:
You must have configured either:
Local LLM via penify config llm, OR
Logged in via penify login

For JIRA enhancement (optional):
Configure JIRA via penify config jira

literallayout.computeroutput:
# Stage your changes git add .
# Generate commit message penify commit
# Commit with the generated message git commit -m "Generated message here"

# Stage your changes git add .
# Generate detailed commit message with JIRA integration, # provide context, and open editor for review penify commit -m "Fix login issue" -d -e
# The commit is automatically completed after you save and exit the editor

listitem.para:
**"No LLM model or API token provided"**
Run penify config llm to configure a local LLM, or
Run penify login to authenticate with Penify

**"Failed to connect to JIRA"**
Check your JIRA configuration with cat ~/.penify
Verify your network connection
Ensure your JIRA credentials are valid

**"Error initializing LLM client"**
Verify your LLM configuration settings
Ensure the LLM API is accessible
